instructions:
Call Summarization 2 E911

For this test, you will need to listen to information that is provided to you through the computer. We recommend using a headset or a set of quality speakers. You will then be asked a series of questions about each of the calls.

You should enter the information that the caller gives in the appropriate boxes on the computer screen. For example, you should enter the caller's first name, last name, street address, city, and/or telephone number in the boxes marked for that information. You should enter any vehicle identification number, License Plate, or Driver's License provided by the caller in the boxes marked for that information.

You may write notes about the calls in the box in the lower half of the screen labeled Notes to help you recall information about the call.

The information you record in any of the boxes on the screen will later be available to assist you in choosing the correct answer.

After each call is completed, follow the on-screen instructions to proceed to the questions about that call.

You will also need to respond to any emergency messages that appear in the bottom right corner of the screen by left clicking your mouse over the agency to be dispatched. Failing to respond to a decision-making message within 15 seconds after the message first appears will result in a lower score.

HOW TO RESPOND TO MULTIPLE-CHOICE QUESTION

With each question there will be four choices labeled A, B, C, and D. You can choose your response in one of three ways.

1. You can use your mouse to select your answers

2. You can use the up and down arrows to choose your response.

3. You can hold down the Alt key and then press either A, B, C, or D.

Press Alt+s to pause the background audio while accessing Emergency box. Press Alt+r to resume the background audio.

mcqQuestions.questionText: According to the caller, there were _______________ ladies who came into the diner for coffee?
The ladies asked the caller to meet them at a bar
The caller reported that there was damage to a
The ladies asked the caller to meet them at a bar that is located on Bellevue
The pickup truck mentioned in this scenario is described as being _______ in color.

asset.text: Here is a picture of the car speeding past the school.
This a picture of the school.
Here is another picture but this time of the children near the school.

mcqQuestions.questionText: The caller said that the suspicious vehicle is located
According to the caller, the suspicious vehicle is

options.text: backed up to the front door of the house.
parked on the street in front of the house.
parked in an unknown direction in the driveway.

mcqQuestions.questionText: According to the caller, the suspicious vehicle has been at the location he indicated for approximately
According to this caller, what kinds of items were being loaded into the vehicle?

options.text: The specific types of items were NOT identified.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Based on the information received, what is the most accurate description of the suspicious vehicle?

asset.text: This a picture that was taken at 10:00am of the scene.
This a video that was taken at 11:00am of the scene.

mcqQuestions.questionText: According this caller, the accident occurred
According to this caller, the accident occurred on or near ____________ Street.
According to this caller, the passenger in the rear seat of the car is

options.text: huddled in a pile of empty bottles.

mcqQuestions.questionText: The age of the passenger in the right front seat is described as being

options.text: The caller did not specify an age for this passenger.

mcqQuestions.questionText: Which of the following is true about this call?

options.text: There was a pile of beer bottles on the front seat of the car.
The girl in the back seat of the car has a cut on her chin.
A. No one in the car was wearing a seat belt.
The car in the accident struck a fire hydrant.

captions.CS312:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.810 --> 00:00:01.430
Hi.

2
00:00:01.800 --> 00:00:03.740
This is Jessica Winston again.

3
00:00:03.960 --> 00:00:08.045
Jessica J E S S I C A

5
00:00:08.340 --> 00:00:12.220
Winston W I N S T O N.

7
00:00:13.110 --> 00:00:15.060
I know you guys are getting tired of
hearing from

8
00:00:15.061 --> 00:00:16.890
me. My husband says I should

9
00:00:16.891 --> 00:00:18.110
mind my own business.

10
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:25.070
I live it 2 7 5 2 Conrad C O N R A D
 
13
00:00:25.290 --> 00:00:27.110
in the city of Dilton

14
00:00:27.360 --> 00:00:29.890
D I L T O N.

16
00:00:30.870 --> 00:00:33.020
My next door neighbors are on
vacation.

17
00:00:33.420 --> 00:00:35.160
I saw them leave last Thursday

18
00:00:35.161 --> 00:00:36.059
with their luggage

19
00:00:36.060 --> 00:00:38.390
and they told me there should be no
one home.

20
00:00:38.930 --> 00:00:41.400
There is this vehicle a suspicious

21
00:00:41.401 --> 00:00:43.260
vehicle backed up to the garage in
the

22
00:00:43.261 --> 00:00:44.030
driveway.

23
00:00:44.550 --> 00:00:46.620
Some people are loading all sorts of
stuff

24
00:00:46.621 --> 00:00:47.690
into a car.

25
00:00:48.150 --> 00:00:50.129
I know it's not my neighbors cars
since

26
00:00:50.130 --> 00:00:51.920
they drive a blue Chevy van.

27
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:53.240
Oh yeah.

28
00:00:53.400 --> 00:00:55.109
You already have my phone number.

29
00:00:55.110 --> 00:00:56.810
But here it is again

30
00:00:57.270 --> 00:01:01.040
8 6 8 4 8 7 5.

32
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:03.500
I know the last time I called you

33
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:05.309
you guys said it was unfounded

34
00:01:05.310 --> 00:01:06.200
or something.

35
00:01:06.660 --> 00:01:08.550
That time someone was watering the
plants

36
00:01:08.551 --> 00:01:10.490
of my neighbor who lives across the
street.

37
00:01:12.030 --> 00:01:14.210
My husband said I should mind my own
business.

38
00:01:14.940 --> 00:01:16.049
Oh never mind.

39
00:01:16.050 --> 00:01:17.360
It's probably nothing.

40
00:01:17.700 --> 00:01:19.620
It's just that I know that old
silver

41
00:01:19.621 --> 00:01:22.160
Toyota doesn't belong in this
neighborhood

42
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:24.950
since they have been there about 45
minutes.

43
00:01:25.170 --> 00:01:26.159
I had time to go over

44
00:01:26.160 --> 00:01:28.580
and copy the vehicle identification
number

45
00:01:29.250 --> 00:01:31.140
of the car in case they're robbing
the

46
00:01:31.141 --> 00:01:32.330
place or something.

47
00:01:32.760 --> 00:01:34.520
The VIN number

48
00:01:34.740 --> 00:01:45.790
is 2 T M P A P 6 4 D L E 4 4 3 5 P.

53
00:01:46.780 --> 00:01:48.610
Maybe you could check out my
neighbor's house when

54
00:01:48.611 --> 00:01:49.390
you're in the area.
captions.CS313:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.840 --> 00:00:03.450
My name is Regina Watson.

2
00:00:03.870 --> 00:00:06.550
R E G I N A.

4
00:00:06.780 --> 00:00:10.640
Watson W A T S O N.

6
00:00:11.280 --> 00:00:12.860
I live in the town of Harley

7
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:23.460
H A R L E Y at 2 3 4 2 1
Winston W I N S T O N.

12
00:00:24.360 --> 00:00:26.372
Have you had any reports of an
accident?

13
00:00:27.060 --> 00:00:28.469
I don't want to be a busybody

14
00:00:28.470 --> 00:00:30.390
but I think it's important for
people to become

15
00:00:30.391 --> 00:00:31.160
involved.

16
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:33.989
I was at the lumber yard on 7th
Street

17
00:00:33.990 --> 00:00:35.750
loading my stuff into my car.

18
00:00:35.940 --> 00:00:37.619
You know the one in 7th Street

19
00:00:37.620 --> 00:00:39.740
and not the lumberyard on Niccolò
Street.

20
00:00:40.140 --> 00:00:42.060
Anyway I saw this accident

21
00:00:42.061 --> 00:00:43.490
happened right in front of me.

22
00:00:43.770 --> 00:00:45.780
I waited for five minutes for
someone to show

23
00:00:45.781 --> 00:00:47.750
up to help but nobody has.

24
00:00:48.210 --> 00:00:50.309
So now I'm calling the driver.

25
00:00:50.310 --> 00:00:52.320
The car has a small cut on her chin

26
00:00:52.321 --> 00:00:54.170
where she hit it on the steering
wheel

27
00:00:54.290 --> 00:00:56.720
but I don't think she's all there if
you know what I mean.

28
00:00:57.060 --> 00:00:58.559
I mean she looks pretty dazed

29
00:00:58.560 --> 00:01:00.470
and she keeps talking to herself

30
00:01:00.840 --> 00:01:02.700
but her little boy isn't looking too
good

31
00:01:02.701 --> 00:01:03.380
at all.

32
00:01:03.690 --> 00:01:05.900
I think he may be hurt pretty badly.

33
00:01:06.390 --> 00:01:08.280
There he is bleeding all

34
00:01:08.281 --> 00:01:10.310
huddled up in a little pile of empty
bottles

35
00:01:10.311 --> 00:01:11.960
in the right front seat of the car.

36
00:01:12.450 --> 00:01:14.630
Actually he isn't that little

37
00:01:14.640 --> 00:01:16.130
he's about 12 years old

38
00:01:16.560 --> 00:01:18.389
and I think the girl in the backseat

39
00:01:18.390 --> 00:01:20.280
must have passed out because she
isn't

40
00:01:20.281 --> 00:01:21.230
moving at all.

41
00:01:22.080 --> 00:01:23.030
By the way,

42
00:01:23.040 --> 00:01:24.650
the car's license plate is

43
00:01:24.910 --> 00:01:28.100
5 4 3 V T D.

45
00:01:28.770 --> 00:01:29.999
I saw the whole thing

46
00:01:30.000 --> 00:01:31.950
and neither of the kids was wearing
a seatbelt

47
00:01:31.951 --> 00:01:33.440
when they hit the fire hydrant.

48
00:01:33.840 --> 00:01:35.670
Let me tell you I don't think

49
00:01:35.671 --> 00:01:38.070
they should let anyone under the age
of 21

50
00:01:38.071 --> 00:01:40.100
right in a car without a seatbelt
on.

51
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:42.570
There are lots of damn negligent
people

52
00:01:42.571 --> 00:01:43.340
out there.

53
00:01:43.680 --> 00:01:45.119
I know you already have this

54
00:01:45.120 --> 00:01:46.700
but my telephone number is

55
00:01:46.950 --> 00:01:50.180
8 3 7 4 7 3 1.

57
00:01:50.670 --> 00:01:52.740
I guess you better send the cops
before something

58
00:01:52.741 --> 00:01:53.730
else bad happens.
